Secondary - Conduct secondary analysis across project ( i.e. , perceive need benefit CISRC intervention intervention efficacy across three high priority cancer patient population ) make possible use common theoretical framework , similar intervention research design across project , common set endpoint . OUTLINE : This multicenter study . Patients assess demographic question baseline interview conduct Cancer Information Service ( CIS ) Information Specialists . Patients randomize 1 3 intervention group : - Group 1 : Patients receive mail contain standard CIS print material . In project 1 , patient receive `` Treatment Choices Men Early-Stage Prostate Cancer '' `` What You Need Know About Prostate Cancer '' . In project 2 , patient receive `` What You Need Know About Breast Cancer '' `` Surgery Choices Women Early-Stage Breast Cancer '' . In project 3 , patient receive `` Facing Forward : Life After Cancer Treatment '' `` What You Need Know About Breast Cancer '' . - Group 2 : Patients receive mailing appropriate project group 1 . Patients also receive multimedia program via Internet CD-ROM . - Group 3 : In project 3 , patient receive mailing appropriate project group 1 multimedia program group 2 . Patients also receive CIS callback intervention 10-14 day train Information Specialists CIS . After completion study therapy , patient follow 2 9 month .
